[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-26 01:21:30.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/huawei/v3/connection.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/huawei/test_huawei_nas.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-huawei-exception-a09b73234ksd94kd.yaml'], 'message': 'Huawei: Fix exception in update_access not found

When share is deleted in the backend, user is unable to delete
share because of error thrown in update_access(). Make backend raise
ShareResourceNotFound exception in case share not found during
"update_access" operation, because share manager expects it for
proper handling of share deletion, thus allowing share to be
deleted in this case, without having to use force-delete.

After add ShareResourceNotFound exception, it will need a parameter
named share id(share['id']), so add share id to share info in
create_share_from_snapshot function.

Change-Id: I9756ff882e6960b07f5f0abac94057c687830ad0
Closes-Bug: #1585035
'}]
commit_message:
Huawei: Fix exception in update_access not found

When share is deleted in the backend, user is unable to delete
share because of error thrown in update_access(). Make backend raise
ShareResourceNotFound exception in case share not found during
"update_access" operation, because share manager expects it for
proper handling of share deletion, thus allowing share to be
deleted in this case, without having to use force-delete.

After add ShareResourceNotFound exception, it will need a parameter
named share id(share['id']), so add share id to share info in
create_share_from_snapshot function.

Change-Id: I9756ff882e6960b07f5f0abac94057c687830ad0
Closes-Bug: #1585035

commit_message:
New way to get list of all physical ethernet interfaces

Changes:

* support predictable network interfaces naming based [0]
* better and more reliable way to detect non-virtual, not a wireless ethernet interfaces.
* support old and new Ruby version (1.8.7+)

[0] http://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/systemd/PredictableNetworkInterfaceNames

Co-Authored-By: Alexei Sheplyakov <asheplyakov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ia61b23beaef38d3d74bf195d58c1e30dac690b7f
Closes-Bug: #1502198
(cherry picked from commit 3e9d17211d65c80bf97c8d83979979f6c7feb687)

subject: Add support for dsv-volume-type mappings
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-13 14:24:03.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst', 'tests/test_titles.py', 'specs/newton/datastore-version-volume-type-support.rst'], 'message': 'Add support for dsv-volume-type mappings

Cinder exposes volume types and a user can specify the volume type when
requesting a new instance (implementation for this is under way, see
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/volume-type-on-create).

This BP proposes adding the capability to restrict the volume types that
can be used for each datastore just the same as the current ability to
restrict flavors to datastores.

Implements: blueprint associate-volume-type-datastore
Change-Id: I79f36019060993bf7c645bcf4358cf6bfa8547f8
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for dsv-volume-type mappings

Cinder exposes volume types and a user can specify the volume type when
requesting a new instance (implementation for this is under way, see
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/volume-type-on-create).

This BP proposes adding the capability to restrict the volume types that
can be used for each datastore just the same as the current ability to
restrict flavors to datastores.

Implements: blueprint associate-volume-type-datastore
Change-Id: I79f36019060993bf7c645bcf4358cf6bfa8547f8

commit_message:
Set 'deployed_before' attribute in cluster attributes if not present

Before this change if  master node had been upgraded to Fuel of
versions >= 8.0, attempt to re/deploy existing clusters would have failed
as attributes of those clusters would have lack 'deployed_before' field.

Since processing of the flag is temporary solution it should not be
coded in data base migration logic. Thus the change introduces creating
of the attribute with given value if it is not already present.

Change-Id: I302ddb340d2ecf14b1fa414fda71aa7f32363bdf
Closes-Bug: #1551339
(cherry picked from commit cfa146e9dd7d1579fc4baa7580aedb8afb57414c)

commit_message:
Rename session_client to make_rest_client

While writing some docs, it became clear that session_client was just a
horrible horrible name and that I'm a bad person. Rename it so that we
can make docs that make humans happy.

Also, move the REST client section of the README up a bit.

Change-Id: I1a27853e3031489da5916308a76f19bc72185d24

commit_message:
Remove admin role name 'admin' hardcode

Because of hardcoding name as the 'admin' was impossible to
use administrative panel with a custom administrative role name.
This fix replaces hardcoding the name of the administrative role
with RBAC policy check.

DocImpact
Related commit: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/123745/
Change-Id: I05c8fc750c56f6f6bb49a435662e821eb0d6ba30
Closes-Bug: #1161144

subject: Refactor locale tests and unicode issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-01 14:30:37.000000000', 'files': ['swift/__init__.py', 'test/unit/test_locale/test_locale.py', 'test/unit/test_locale/messages.mo', 'test/unit/test_locale/eo.po'], 'message': 'Refactor locale tests and unicode issue

There is an issue if someone uses a non-english locale, that includes
non US-ASCII chars. In that case appending a unicode argument to a
string fails with an error.

This patch refactors the existing test, covering a few more different
cases with english and non-english locales. The last test currently
fails on master with an UnicodeDecodeError; this is fixed by the gettext
decoding.

Closes-Bug: 1580678
Change-Id: Ia82b3643a4c4edf329c4f7a2b05638f9de962c05
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor locale tests and unicode issue

There is an issue if someone uses a non-english locale, that includes
non US-ASCII chars. In that case appending a unicode argument to a
string fails with an error.

This patch refactors the existing test, covering a few more different
cases with english and non-english locales. The last test currently
fails on master with an UnicodeDecodeError; this is fixed by the gettext
decoding.

Closes-Bug: 1580678
Change-Id: Ia82b3643a4c4edf329c4f7a2b05638f9de962c05

commit_message:
utils: Move is_volume_backed_instance into compute_utils

This is to allow the method to be used outside of the compute api.
Also rename the required get_root_bdm method to avoid confusion with
a block_device method of the same name.

Implements: blueprint virt-rescue-stable-disk-devices
Change-Id: I475d6fd68f761e2a3f76118703159d82169f6077

subject: Add helper method for OpenStack SDK constructor
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-01 07:54:36.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/sdk-helper-41f8d815cfbcfb00.yaml', 'README.rst', 'os_client_config/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Add helper method for OpenStack SDK constructor

openstacksdk already has a helper method for dealing with occ, but if a
user is already using the occ helper methods, there is no reason we
should not provide them an easy path to using the SDK.

commit_message:
Add helper method for OpenStack SDK constructor

openstacksdk already has a helper method for dealing with occ, but if a
user is already using the occ helper methods, there is no reason we
should not provide them an easy path to using the SDK.

Change-Id: I1040efb94385fdac0aa02ac960ba95089b954377

commit_message:
Do not install glare murano config under UCA

UCA does not provide the murano glance artifacts plugin so we need to
exclude it's configuration when deploying UCA.

DocImpact: UCA with murano does not install and configure glare as it is
not available with UCA packages. It will continue to use murano for the
artifact repository when UCA is used.

Change-Id: I356600cf410aaf0ce32f25ff18642e135b7380e9
Closes-Bug: #1586141
(cherry picked from commit 874b4350b4e3cb4a19aedb1d09f4fbcc1fec6f2d)

commit_message:
Explicitly disable creating nova v3 endpoint

Upstream patch I8990ce21745fa7a995b92ed337622fa6ffc2756b can not
be backported to mitaka because of backward compatibilty issues, hence
we need additional fix for stable/mitaka in library.
But still we can manually disable creation of Nova v3 endpoint.

Change-Id: I7b453b72bc23e48645a662097feea62e3b371a66
Closes-bug: #1586977
Related-bug: #1581459

timeout and retry interval. But the VM scenarios doesn't expose this

This patchset is to expose these options to provide more flexibility

commit_message:
Expose ssh timeout and interval in vm scenarios

The SSH class in sshutils.py has the options to config SSH wait
timeout and retry interval. But the VM scenarios doesn't expose this
to user.

This patchset is to expose these options to provide more flexibility
for user to adjust timeout.

Change-Id: Ie0353691579c760687e17624c2ed3375e2b1bbc0
Closes-bugs: 1587728

commit_message:
Mock time.sleep in ISCSIConnectorTestCase

When '_test_connect_volume' is run, 'wait_for_volume_removal'
will be called. Neither this method, nor time.sleep is mocked, for
which reason this test will take about 20 seconds to complete.

This patch simply mocks time.sleep for this test.

Change-Id: Iceb0d30ce9f831f5929387eca6918500bbdab944

We are only able to store static content at the dashboard (app) level.
This forces us to store all of our statics under the dashboard's static folder.

This patch introduces a panel static finder. Django's static finder will now
find files inside the panel's static folder as well. This is more inline with what

Change-Id: I2bb3f78abf8854dbad8f1697d942f94d36014d41
Closes-Bug: #1544295"}]
commit_message:
Panel static finder

We are only able to store static content at the dashboard (app) level.
This forces us to store all of our statics under the dashboard's static folder.

This patch introduces a panel static finder. Django's static finder will now
find files inside the panel's static folder as well. This is more inline with what
we have today for python plugins.

Change-Id: I2bb3f78abf8854dbad8f1697d942f94d36014d41
Closes-Bug: #1544295

commit_message:
Adding python-oneviewclient to projects.txt

python-oneviewclient is a library used by Ironic to deal with HPE OneView
managed infrastructure. Since it's used by Ironic, requirements shared by
the two projects should be consistent. This patch addes python-oneviewclient
to projects.txt so it can be updated when the global-requirements changes for
projects.

Depends-On: Ia32d66aa7af07f69e1dfd2c28bc8ca96c0832376
Change-Id: I721f2b527cf8249364a7bb670e4a58d43b4f1354

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-21 13:17:41.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/shell.py'], 'message': "[Trivial] Remove unnecessary executable privilege

glanceclient/shell.py defines a main entry, however this file cannot

commit_message:
[Trivial] Remove unnecessary executable privilege

glanceclient/shell.py defines a main entry, however this file cannot
be executed directly because we do not call the main function in
this file. It is actually a module which will be used by
/usr/bin/glance, hence doesn't need to be executable.

Change-Id: I8b45ac7b8b88265cfc27e5ba7201e4766d9dc276

subject: Fix V-38496 on Ubuntu 16.04
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 14:27:42.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/auth.yml'], 'message': 'Fix V-38496 on Ubuntu 16.04

Running V-38496 on Ubuntu 16.04 fails with the following issue:

FAILED! => {"changed": false, "failed": true, "msg": "FAILED: System accounts are unlocked: "}

The content of the variable v38496_violations is "\n". Because of the the length check of
v38496_violations will fail.

Replacing all "\n" with "" prior to the length check will solve the issue.

Change-Id: Iac3b8a4f7f0f3b719ce74c9a7e57c1ebedf5775d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix V-38496 on Ubuntu 16.04

Running V-38496 on Ubuntu 16.04 fails with the following issue:

FAILED! => {"changed": false, "failed": true, "msg": "FAILED: System accounts are unlocked: "}

The content of the variable v38496_violations is "\n". Because of the the length check of
v38496_violations will fail.

Replacing all "\n" with "" prior to the length check will solve the issue.

Change-Id: Iac3b8a4f7f0f3b719ce74c9a7e57c1ebedf5775d

commit_message:
Release Puppet OpenStack 8.1.0 (Mitaka)

This patch adds a new release of Puppet OpenStack modules for
our Mitaka branches. All modules will be tagged 8.1.0 (8.x.x)
is our Mitaka versionning except puppet-vswitch that will have 4.1.0.

Change-Id: Ibb883f603075db2c9e187d61a44f24f7878df21a

[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-05-27 16:08:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/ovsdb/native/idlutils.py', 'neutron/agent/ovsdb/api.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_firewall.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/ovsdb/native/test_idlutils.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_ovs_lib.py'], 'message': "functional: fix OVSFW failure with native OVSDB api

A bunch of functional tests fail because of non implemented
x != [] operation in idlutils.condition_match() and
wrong condition passed to db_find() in OVSFW test.
This patch addresses the issue by implementing lists
comparison in native.idlutils and fixing the call to
db_find() in OVSFW test.

A functional test for OVSDB API's db_find() has been
added to ensure that querying a list column gives the same
result both with vsctl and native ovsdb_interface; unit
test for idlutils.condition_match() with corner cases has
been added as well.

Change-Id: Ia93fb925b8814210975904a453249f15f3646855
Closes-bug: #1578233
"}]
commit_message:
functional: fix OVSFW failure with native OVSDB api

A bunch of functional tests fail because of non implemented
x != [] operation in idlutils.condition_match() and
wrong condition passed to db_find() in OVSFW test.
This patch addresses the issue by implementing lists
comparison in native.idlutils and fixing the call to
db_find() in OVSFW test.

A functional test for OVSDB API's db_find() has been
added to ensure that querying a list column gives the same
result both with vsctl and native ovsdb_interface; unit
test for idlutils.condition_match() with corner cases has
been added as well.

Change-Id: Ia93fb925b8814210975904a453249f15f3646855
Closes-bug: #1578233

commit_message:
Support detailed puppet run report

Without this change Astute send only combined summary: part data
from last_run_summary and part data from last_run_report.
With this change user can setup Astute send detailed report in
summary by setup 'puppet_raw_report' in Astute config.
In this case Astute will also send raw_report field with
full puppet run report.

Change-Id: I52bd709fc3fdd44d5477f75bdb36d063a2754555
(cherry picked from commit 065bc28c803ec3e839b5d3758a9e505f408603fb)

commit_message:
Enable proxy header handling for nova

Nova is using http_proxy_to_wsgi middleware[1][2]. This parses the
headers provided by the proxy, and helps us properly use TLS for
keystone discovery. There was an option introduced in this middleware
to have it disabled by default, and this change enables it.

[1] Ia78f73e96585ab33a379a0b0be6d9682f7fbd810
[2] I808469f24066d382decf55b9dad5312d6e068da7

Change-Id: I3918f24c0c87cb626a28645b46e3df6360d5f924

By default devstack installs keystone under mod_wsgi, our keystone is
deployed differently. Since we don't deploy keystone on slaves nodes

Closes-Bug: #1587883

Change-Id: I9416786aeeddb346120c297db688650b705c2a9d

commit_message:
Set KEYSTONE_DEPLOY variable to uwsgi

By default devstack installs keystone under mod_wsgi, our keystone is
deployed differently. Since we don't deploy keystone on slaves nodes
we need to make sure that devstack knows about how we deployed it.

Closes-Bug: #1587883

Co-Authored-By: Kirill Zaitsev <kzaitsev@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I9416786aeeddb346120c297db688650b705c2a9d

commit_message:
WIP - Shadow LDAP and custom driver users

This patch creates a new shadow table for mapping non-local
users to local identities. By non-local, I mean non-sql and
non-federated, so essentially, LDAP and custom driver identities.

user -> local_user (sql driver)
     -> nonlocal_user (ldap, custom driver)
     -> federated_user

"One user to rule them all"

bp shadow-users-newton

Change-Id: If82deba7101aac3287aeb8f613fb497387ee75f4

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 7428, 'name': 'Yaroslav Lobankov', 'email': 'lobankovyv@gmail.com', 'username': 'ylobankov'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11662, 'name': 'Paul Glass', 'email': 'paul.glass@rackspace.com', 'username': 'pglass'}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12024, 'name': 'Tong Liu', 'email': 'tongl@vmware.com', 'username': 'tong101'}, {'_account_id': 17716, 'name': 'Luz Cazares', 'email': 'luz.cazares@intel.com', 'username': 'luzcazares'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-19 00:06:54.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/common/rest_client.py', 'tempest/tests/lib/test_rest_client.py'], 'message': 'Fix rest_client's expected_success for non int status

rest_client's expected_success() method expect expected_code
and read_code as int and compare both.

But if read_code is non int then this method will not compare anything
and pass falsely.

condition "if read_code < 400:" makes comparision of both status code but
return the results. But if read_code is not int then this condition is
alse and it make this method pass wihtout any compariosion.

It is written in doc string that read_code should be int but if anyone try
to send non int then it might be false pass.

self.expected_success(200, '202') - pass. This is false pass.

read_code is usually a status code return from API which can be fetched as
string via dict element like resp['status'].

Some user tried to access that and faced the issue, one example of this
wrong usage is:
If01461617020f39b4da554b127e7b5e5fd704645

Change-Id: I3f4c58bdbb172805514831103927d3464d65d7f3
Closes-Bug: #1571443
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rest_client's expected_success for non int status

rest_client's expected_success() method expect expected_code
and read_code as int and compare both.

But if read_code is non int then this method will not compare anything
and pass falsely.

condition "if read_code < 400:" makes comparision of both status code but
return the results. But if read_code is not int then this condition is
alse and it make this method pass wihtout any compariosion.

It is written in doc string that read_code should be int but if anyone try
to send non int then it might be false pass.

self.expected_success(200, '202') - pass. This is false pass.

read_code is usually a status code return from API which can be fetched as
string via dict element like resp['status'].

Some user tried to access that and faced the issue, one example of this
wrong usage is:
If01461617020f39b4da554b127e7b5e5fd704645

Change-Id: I3f4c58bdbb172805514831103927d3464d65d7f3
Closes-Bug: #1571443

commit_message:
Fixes python 3 urllib quote / unquote usage

Python 3's urllib module no longer contains quote / unquote. Instead,
they have been moved to urllib.parse.

six.moves.urllib will contain the parse submodule on both py2.7 and py3.

Enables some python3 unit tests.

Partially Implements: blueprint nova-python3-newton

Change-Id: I9c85e7179ef1178817cb1fe9aa8b574006e740f8

commit_message:
Move is_volume_backed_instance to compute.utils

This function is a method of ComputeAPI, so its callers must have an
instance of the class. This make the usage difficult in modules which
do not need to call ComputeAPI by other reason.

Besides this function does not use any of the class members. So there is
no reason for it to be the class method.

This patch moves this function to compute.utils because it does not use
anything of the class members.

This patch also adds support for the _get_root_bdm and
is_volume_backed_instance to read from a dictionary instead of an
Instance object. Because of this we can call is_volume_backed_instance
from build_request_spec and fix bug #1469179.

Change-Id: I6d446088faf500ed39a4504794d09d0f86e2bbc3
Co-Authored-By: Feodor Tersin <ftersin@hotmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ankit Agrawal <ankit11.agrawal@nttdata.com>
Related-Bug: #1469179
Related-Bug: #1334974
Related-Bug: #1358566

commit_message:
Fix funtional test gate failure caused by keystone client change.

After the merge of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/193894/
the path endpoint is used instead of ports. This causes
functional test failure.

This patch fixes this.

Change-Id: Ic052e518cbb8be531a048129ad47cd19ad460268
Closes-bug: #1586222

subject: Create symlink for libvirt save directory
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-01 04:34:02.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_pre_install.yml', 'tasks/nova_compute_kvm_install.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/symlink_libvirt_save_dir_to_nova_dir-3b1b278cb7e5831f.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Create symlink for libvirt save directory

Nova can fill up the partition that /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save is on
when nova calls `image-create` on an instance.  This occurs because
nova calls libvirt with managedsave which creates a temporary file in
the /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save location.  Libvirt does not allow the
location of /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save to be configurable so we have
to manage it ourselves via bindmounts or symlinks.

In this commit we remove the /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save directory and
create a symlink in it's place, pointing to
`{{ nova_system_home_folder }}/save` instead (which we also create).
This location was chosen as deployers often have more space here for
nova instances.

Change-Id: I5c96f70aa355cc02379fe7e0681416eca53447eb
Partial-Bug: #1585325
(cherry picked from commit 2599006a81eeb2632a87f5b00d27d5f061f7d14e)
"}]
commit_message:
Create symlink for libvirt save directory

Nova can fill up the partition that /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save is on
when nova calls `image-create` on an instance.  This occurs because
nova calls libvirt with managedsave which creates a temporary file in
the /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save location.  Libvirt does not allow the
location of /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save to be configurable so we have
to manage it ourselves via bindmounts or symlinks.

In this commit we remove the /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save directory and
create a symlink in it's place, pointing to
`{{ nova_system_home_folder }}/save` instead (which we also create).
This location was chosen as deployers often have more space here for
nova instances.

Change-Id: I5c96f70aa355cc02379fe7e0681416eca53447eb
Partial-Bug: #1585325
(cherry picked from commit 2599006a81eeb2632a87f5b00d27d5f061f7d14e)

The unlocked account check for V-34896 always fails in Ansible 2.2,

Closes-bug: 1585349

Change-Id: Ib96dfafa711fccae9451b541e099cdb7748da8a3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unlocked account check on Ansible 2.2

The unlocked account check for V-34896 always fails in Ansible 2.2,
even when there are no unlocked accounts on the system. This patch
simplifies the jinja loop and rejects any empty lines.

This is a manual backport of I11728e24f341ec696da3a761f02087266341cf2a
from master.

Closes-bug: 1585349

Change-Id: Ib96dfafa711fccae9451b541e099cdb7748da8a3

commit_message:
Fix unlocked account check on Ansible 2.2

The unlocked account check for V-34896 always fails in Ansible 2.2,
even when there are no unlocked accounts on the system. This patch
simplifies the jinja loop and rejects any empty lines.

This is a manual backport of I11728e24f341ec696da3a761f02087266341cf2a
from the master branch.

Closes-bug: 1585349

Change-Id: Iecb778c5c233baa5d0d84da43a45f15155d9f15e

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-26 13:50:15.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/imagecache.py', 'releasenotes/notes/deprecate-image-cache-checksumming-80e52279881ebc71.yaml', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_imagecache.py', 'nova/conf/libvirt.py'], 'message': "Remove image cache image verification

There was a substantial amount of code in the image cache devoted to
checksumming images. However, these checksums were never used beyond
the generation of a log message during the image cache manager's
periodic task of the form:

  Corrupt base files: ...

This code was expensive to run, added significant complexity to the
image cache manager, and not actually used by anything. This patch
removes it. The only functional change should be that the above log
message is no longer generated.

We can't remove it completely in this pass because the image cache
may be on shared storage with an old compute host which expects these
files to exist. Consequently we retain the code to delete the image
metadata file when deleting an entry from the cache, and we don't
delete these files automatically when we find them. These vestiges can
be removed in Ocata.

Additional context can be found here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/095751.html

Change-Id: I3d84117809d5058cb2c779754523913347d5374b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove image cache image verification

There was a substantial amount of code in the image cache devoted to
checksumming images. However, these checksums were never used beyond
the generation of a log message during the image cache manager's
periodic task of the form:

  Corrupt base files: ...

This code was expensive to run, added significant complexity to the
image cache manager, and not actually used by anything. This patch
removes it. The only functional change should be that the above log
message is no longer generated.

We can't remove it completely in this pass because the image cache
may be on shared storage with an old compute host which expects these
files to exist. Consequently we retain the code to delete the image
metadata file when deleting an entry from the cache, and we don't
delete these files automatically when we find them. These vestiges can
be removed in Ocata.

Additional context can be found here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/095751.html

Change-Id: I3d84117809d5058cb2c779754523913347d5374b

commit_message:
ovsdb: Don't skip ovsdb test cases in py34 suite

Post-2.5 ovs Python library now supports Python 3 [1] and we require
2.6dev version for py34 job, so we're fine to run ovsdb tests with
Python 3.

[1] https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/99c8be3ee47022ce7e02070a5a0a420555c9a720

Change-Id: Id87223eea45d1343a05d8fdcde08f26fe5486a30

Running in maintenance mode resources remain in unmanaged state

Plus excessive reqs (which caused loops) have been removed

commit_message:
Scale controllers up/down using pacemaker m-mode

Put pacemaker into maintenance mode for the critical ops
(e.g. adding/removing nodes) being done to the cluster.
Running in maintenance mode resources remain in unmanaged state
and have no impact by unnecessary restarts.
Plus excessive reqs (which caused loops) have been removed
from the following tasks:
  - openstack-haproxy-mysqld
  - conntrackd
  - cluster_health

Change-Id: Ibe00effa7c9b5c6d8209f977815272447819bc22
Closes-Bug: #1555203

commit_message:
fix Quota related error return incorrect problem

in Nova API layer, 400 is returned (HTTPBadRequest) if Quota is exceeded,
this is not correct
we should return 403 (HTTPForbidden) instead

Change-Id: Ifd9d3c6db5b3ec56c744255bf26575f748e13ff3
Closes-Bug: #1451991

commit_message:
Setup OSA os_swift core group

This patch implements a core group for the openstack-ansible-os_swift
repository in order to allow a service specific set of cores to be
added to it.

The openstack-ansible-core team also retains core voting capabilities.

Change-Id: I9a0d9cbed18d57aa5bce1bfbc81f2f3c5b33feac

commit_message:
Update swarm templates to use Heat resources

Swarm templates still use the AWS:: resource, which needs
to be updated to "OS::Heat::WaitConditionHandle" or
"OS::Heat::WaitCondition" instead.

Co-Author-By: Hongbin Lu <hongbin.lu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I1bca41b8dfcd56e29df6b90f786c66175b7dd9e8
Closes-Bug: #1583725

commit_message:
Add building hadoop swiftfs jars

Changed build-all-artifacts job for building hadoop openstack jars
with our swiftfs implementation (for each of 2.2.0, 2.3.0, 2.5.0,
2.6.0 and 2.7.1 hadoop versions).

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-27 14:26:44.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bgpvpn/tests/unit/services/bagpipe/test_bagpipe.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/bagpipe/agent_extension.py'], 'message': 'bagpipe: really use the extension-specific cookie

The code in OVSBridgeIntercept was not behaving
as intended:
- the extension cookie was not applied as expected, even
  for the ofctl-based OVSTunnelBridge (interference with
  class inheritance, because __getattr__ does not let us
  override methods existing in a parent class,
  __getattribute__ has to be used instead)
- the extension cookie would never have been applied
  for the native.OVSTunnelBridge that does not use add_flow

This changes corrects the code and adds a test case.

We also now import the neutron constants from neutron-lib.

(cherry picked from commit ccc13f755b66c32757a1505a073ab5316642d3b2)

Change-Id: I779d7a8bf7fc31d936d1e401e4726711c8404ed2
Closes-Bug: 1582598
'}]
commit_message:
bagpipe: really use the extension-specific cookie

The code in OVSBridgeIntercept was not behaving
as intended:
- the extension cookie was not applied as expected, even
  for the ofctl-based OVSTunnelBridge (interference with
  class inheritance, because __getattr__ does not let us
  override methods existing in a parent class,
  __getattribute__ has to be used instead)
- the extension cookie would never have been applied
  for the native.OVSTunnelBridge that does not use add_flow

This changes corrects the code and adds a test case.

We also now import the neutron constants from neutron-lib.

(cherry picked from commit ccc13f755b66c32757a1505a073ab5316642d3b2)

Change-Id: I779d7a8bf7fc31d936d1e401e4726711c8404ed2
Closes-Bug: 1582598

commit_message:
Remove unused network uuid check

The old logic expects the network uuid may has a `br-` prefix,
which is no longer used. Just remove it.

This code snippet was introduced in this bug[0]. But after removed it,
nothing is broken, including the VMware NSX CI.

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1021370

Change-Id: If738bd935349ae3c3758a2ea66d536c5e956a160

commit_message:
Fix post-deployment pxe interface detection

W/o this fix node do not respond with proper PUT for pxe interface
as the pxe interface gets plugged into br-fw-admin bridge and
it is not reported as pxe-related one.

We should check if the interface is a part of bond and/or bridge
configuration and respond correctly.

Change-Id: Ifc1c396b0945fc5a42165b969b6924dcff5975b2
Closes-bug: #1581517
(cherry picked from commit 5fa721206baf3fad3fec424b0cdbe5013238c195)

commit_message:
Remove unused WsgiLimiter

There is unused class WsgiLimiter. The class exists in legacy v2 API
code, and the class will be removed with whole files. However, we need
to remove the class separatelly because it uses DEFAULT_LIMITS which is
necessary to be moved into newer v2.1 API code to operate unit tests.
So this patch removes WsgiLimiter.

Change-Id: I7234217991e83023894e2c2a2e9303a4186ff8dd

RateLimitingMiddleware, but they are not used now.
So this patch removes them for the code cleanup.

commit_message:
Fixed module-apply on removed module

If you apply a module, remove it and then apply it again it would
no longer show up in the module-query command. This has been fixed
and corresponding tests added to the module scenario run.

Also added missing 'object' to ModuleManager class

Closes-Bug: #1571799
(cherry picked from commit I3302a2547cf88f1da1ba4abca6617981572782d4)

Change-Id: Idecead4b9f021da16bf1b138718b5169bce01205

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-05-02 19:11:29.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/slo-backups-3c35135316f837e1.yaml', 'trove/tests/unittests/backup/test_storage.py', 'trove/tests/fakes/swift.py', 'trove/taskmanager/models.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/backup/test_backupagent.py', 'trove/guestagent/backup/backupagent.py', 'trove/common/strategies/storage/base.py', 'trove/common/strategies/storage/swift.py'], 'message': "Backup to swift using wrong large object type

Trove backups are stored in Swift as Dynamic Large Objects. This is not
ideal, and could cause restore to fail as DLOs may not return all of
their parts. Static Large Objects should be used instead. SLOs perform
checksum and object size validation and can reduce object download times
significantly.

Changes are needed to the Swift storage strategy and taskmanager's
backup delete model to perform actions on SLOs. The corresponding
unittests and fakes are also updated.

A special case occurs when the backup object fits in a single Swift
object segment, in which case it will not be made a SLO.

Change-Id: Ide30a1e7f909a3b7fecb16268367b56468306d42
Closes-bug: 1489997
"}]
commit_message:
Backup to swift using wrong large object type

Trove backups are stored in Swift as Dynamic Large Objects. This is not
ideal, and could cause restore to fail as DLOs may not return all of
their parts. Static Large Objects should be used instead. SLOs perform
checksum and object size validation and can reduce object download times
significantly.

Changes are needed to the Swift storage strategy and taskmanager's
backup delete model to perform actions on SLOs. The corresponding
unittests and fakes are also updated.

A special case occurs when the backup object fits in a single Swift
object segment, in which case it will not be made a SLO.

Change-Id: Ide30a1e7f909a3b7fecb16268367b56468306d42
Closes-bug: 1489997

commit_message:
Add RabbitMQ mgmt UI through HAProxy

Backgroud: Bug Requests ability to access
RabbitMQ management UI through HAproxy

Approach:
--Add rabbitmq ui port 15672 to HAProxy
--DO NOT Add monitoring user by default,
instead key on existence of rabbitmw_monitoring_userid
in user_variables.yml
--ADD user_variables.yml update per above with
explanation
--Add "monitoring" user to rabbitmq for monitoring with
"monitoring" user tag
--Add monitoring user passwd var to user_secrets
--Add features: release note

Closes-Bug: 1446434

Change-Id: Idaf02cad6bb292d02f1cf6a733dbbc6ff4b4435e

doesn't really need these configs.

This patch removes the store config namespace from the oslo
config generator's setup to avoid regeneration of store section in
registry sample.

Sample configs have been regenerated using `tox -e genconfig` command to
make sure they reflect the change proposed. Only the

commit_message:
Remove redundant store config from registry sample

Currently, the oslo config generator takes glance_store configs in
consideration while generating sample configs for the registry. Registry
doesn't really need these configs.

This patch removes the store config namespace from the oslo
config generator's setup to avoid regeneration of store section in
registry sample.

Sample configs have been regenerated using `tox -e genconfig` command to
make sure they reflect the change proposed. Only the
glance-registry.conf file has been refreshed as a part of this commit.

Closes-Bug: 1584350

Change-Id: I27c53d281dcd97a30c22a27c4833b24e1ca84f83

commit_message:
Fix 3PAR cg display name issues

Some special characters and long names cause the creation
and/or updating of consistency groups to fail. There is no longer a
need for saving the display_name in the comments as we already have
the CGs UUID. We will simply remove the display name and the
description.

Closes-Bug: #1573647
Change-Id: I4d7aac74cc1c8a1b7cd5c2a35d40e94d681f7213

commit_message:
Adds Hyper-V imagecache cleanup

At the moment the Hyper-V driver's imagecache only deals with caching
the images in _base.

This blueprint will deal with implementing imagecache management that will
allow the aging and deletion of cached images that are no longer in use.

Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Implements blueprint: hyper-v-imagecache-cleanup
Closes-Bug: #1346857

Change-Id: I94ee60ed301f18298ae14239190218b9ef54e575

"Manual". In this case, when a replication recover from a fault, the
replication on storage becomes "to be restored" state. It requires
the administrator to manually synchronize to recover on storage.
Now we change the recovery policy to "Auto". When the stuff happens,
the replication will be executed automatically synchronized.

Change-Id: I78a158454ed613ba9ff8da0169af82600825247e
Closes-Bug: #1586282
'}]
commit_message:
Huawei replication should use auto recovery policy

The recovery policy of replication in huawei driver currently is
"Manual". In this case, when a replication recover from a fault, the
replication on storage becomes "to be restored" state. It requires
the administrator to manually synchronize to recover on storage.
Now we change the recovery policy to "Auto". When the stuff happens,
the replication will be executed automatically synchronized.

Change-Id: I78a158454ed613ba9ff8da0169af82600825247e
Closes-Bug: #1586282

commit_message:
follows cycle-with-intermediary release model

Adds a note to the specification to reflect that ironic follows the
cycle-with-intermediary release model, not the independent
release model.

(At the time, I don't think the cycle-with-intermediary release
model had been defined.)

Also clean up formatting of the references section.

Change-Id: Iea83c12a4b5cd4e5e90d61a54f8587eec86d777a

  encode it to UTF-8 before hashing the content to MD5.
* ClusterController: replace dict.items()[0] with next(iter(dict.items()))
* tox: run the following tests on Python 3.4

  - mysql/test_common.py
  - taskmanager/test_models.py
  - module/test_module_models.py
  - test_cluster_controller.py

Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3
Change-Id: I5372520f9717b4f0279c4b436ca88c160ddf894b

commit_message:
Port more unit tests to Python 3

* Replace string.find(a, b) with a.find(b)
* NamedTemporaryFile: open file in text mode rather than opening it
  in binary mode.
* Module.process_contents(): if contents is a Unicode string, first
  encode it to UTF-8 before hashing the content to MD5.
* ClusterController: replace dict.items()[0] with next(iter(dict.items()))
* tox: run the following tests on Python 3.4

  - mysql/test_common.py
  - taskmanager/test_models.py
  - module/test_module_models.py
  - test_cluster_controller.py

Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3
Change-Id: I5372520f9717b4f0279c4b436ca88c160ddf894b

commit_message:
Unsupported module driver not logged correctly

If an invalid module driver is found, the method is erroneously
printed out instead of the actual 'type.'  This is due
to missing parenthesis in the logging call.

This has been fixed.

Change-Id: I6fb23b3dbbec98de9ee1e2731bcfc56ab3c0ca42
Closes-Bug: #1579900
(cherry picked from commit 970d23ff2ae5449786e95b482dff344d4a48b323)

commit_message:
Improve validation for pseudo-folder name

At the moment, Invalid validation error occur when I specified name
of 1 or 2 letters. And we can not create it.
In addition this, it has the problem which we can create a folder
which is named empty.
So, I modified the validator to the pseudo-folder name.

Closes-Bug: #1514713

Change-Id: I4a763e49545e03829b3035b62d04ec4ff7d13b00

subject: Remove unneeded playbook vars
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-01 02:05:47.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/os-ironic-install.yml'], 'message': 'Remove unneeded playbook vars

ansible_hostname is not used within any tasks and, by default, is the
same value as container_name.

ansible_ssh_host and container_address are also the same value by
default, both are assigned to hosts through the dynamic inventory
script. Additionally, overriding ansible_ssh_host through playbook vars
breaks tasks that delegate to other hosts when using Ansible 2.

Change-Id: I36a9ea861d4139b61084eb1a060907b900aa1162
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unneeded playbook vars

ansible_hostname is not used within any tasks and, by default, is the
same value as container_name.

ansible_ssh_host and container_address are also the same value by
default, both are assigned to hosts through the dynamic inventory
script. Additionally, overriding ansible_ssh_host through playbook vars
breaks tasks that delegate to other hosts when using Ansible 2.

Change-Id: I36a9ea861d4139b61084eb1a060907b900aa1162

commit_message:
[Ci] Make resources cleanup check voting

This patch makes tests.ci.osresources affecting job status,
so if some unexpected resources are found, then job will fail.

To make this possible, this patch adds a piece of code
which filters 'expected' remaining resources.

Also, objects.Endpoint is replaced with objects.Credential

Change-Id: Ief1413071c255e391c31ed21a478d86e2962cb60

subject: Test for unlock_settings_tab feature.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-31 15:11:48.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/tests/test_states_unlock_settings_tab.py', 'fuelweb_test/models/fuel_web_client.py', 'fuelweb_test/models/nailgun_client.py'], 'message': 'Test for unlock_settings_tab feature.

This test checkes that feature "unlock settings"  wiil be working
with different cluster and network settings which
changing during deployment.

        Scenario:
            1. Create cluster
            2. Download default cluster settings
            3. Create custom_config and upload it to cluster
            4. Add 3 nodes with controller role and 2 nodes with compute role
            5. Deploy the cluster
            6. Stop deployment process
            7. Get current settings
            8. Change and save them (that means settings are unlocked)
            9. Redeploy cluster via api
            10. Get cluster and network settings via api (api load deployed)
            11. Compare settings from step 8 and 10 (them must be equal)
            12. Get default settings via api (load defaults)
            13. Compare settings from step 2 and 13 (them must be equal)
            14. Redeploy cluster
            15. Stop deployment process
            16. Redeploy cluster
            17. Run OSTF

Change-Id: Ia72da06a9ebb982d5c22a98bfe162623073aeed9
(cherry picked from commit a8b1cb82758b0028ecdcb173182e5fc608d29dad)
'}]
commit_message:
Test for unlock_settings_tab feature.

This test checkes that feature "unlock settings"  wiil be working
with different cluster and network settings which
changing during deployment.

        Scenario:
            1. Create cluster
            2. Download default cluster settings
            3. Create custom_config and upload it to cluster
            4. Add 3 nodes with controller role and 2 nodes with compute role
            5. Deploy the cluster
            6. Stop deployment process
            7. Get current settings
            8. Change and save them (that means settings are unlocked)
            9. Redeploy cluster via api
            10. Get cluster and network settings via api (api load deployed)
            11. Compare settings from step 8 and 10 (them must be equal)
            12. Get default settings via api (load defaults)
            13. Compare settings from step 2 and 13 (them must be equal)
            14. Redeploy cluster
            15. Stop deployment process
            16. Redeploy cluster
            17. Run OSTF

Change-Id: Ia72da06a9ebb982d5c22a98bfe162623073aeed9
(cherry picked from commit a8b1cb82758b0028ecdcb173182e5fc608d29dad)

commit_message:
Fix support for changing settings for some of the services

Allow a user to change particular openstack and misc
services configuration.

Supports:
  ceilometer
  cinder
  glance
  haproxy
  heat
  mysql
  rabbitmq

DocImpact

Closes-bug: #1580522

Change-Id: I2933846f78c94933419d4dfd3dfbe49178172ff9

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-31 13:22:27.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_openstack_config_task_manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/objects/task.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/handlers/cluster.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/task/helpers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/validators/openstack_config.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_stop_deployment.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/rpc/receiver.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_cluster_changes_handler.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_orchestrator_handlers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/fuel_9_0_1.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_rpc_consumer.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/consts.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_migration_fuel_9_0_1.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/task/manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/task/task.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_task_deploy.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/lcm/task_serializer.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/base.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/handlers/orchestrator.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/lcm/context.py'], 'message': "Allow a user to run dry-run deployment

Now following handlers:

     /clusters/:cluster_id/changes/
     /clusters/:cluster_id/changes/redeploy/
     /clusters/:cluster_id/deploy/
     /clusters/:cluster_id/deploy_tasks/

?dry_run=1 that is telling Astute not to run cluster executionat all.

Dry run assumes that it does not actually affect
cluster status regardless of their result.

Also, remove redundant update of nodes statuses to 'deploying'
within OpenStackConfigManager and DeploymentTaskManager as it should be
done by receiever.

Do not set cluster status to 'deployment' for these nodes in order to
retain its real status

Modify stop deployment tests to move failing stop deployment for already
deployed clusters to another test class. Since 9.0 we can run stop
deployment for new clusters.

Change-Id: I374fc86b63af64411d4a5ca45ff6c3680cb44897
Partial-bug: #1569839
"}]
commit_message:
Allow a user to run dry-run deployment

Now following handlers:

     /clusters/:cluster_id/changes/
     /clusters/:cluster_id/changes/redeploy/
     /clusters/:cluster_id/deploy/
     /clusters/:cluster_id/deploy_tasks/

?dry_run=1 that is telling Astute not to run cluster executionat all.

Dry run assumes that it does not actually affect
cluster status regardless of their result.

Also, remove redundant update of nodes statuses to 'deploying'
within OpenStackConfigManager and DeploymentTaskManager as it should be
done by receiever.

Do not set cluster status to 'deployment' for these nodes in order to
retain its real status

Modify stop deployment tests to move failing stop deployment for already
deployed clusters to another test class. Since 9.0 we can run stop
deployment for new clusters.

Change-Id: I374fc86b63af64411d4a5ca45ff6c3680cb44897
Partial-bug: #1569839

commit_message:
Adding audit rule for SELinux policy modifications

This patch fixes the auditd rules template so that AppArmor and SELinux
policy modifications are logged, depending on which Linux distribution
is in use. The security_audit_apparmor_changes variable has been renamed
to security_audit_mac_changes to be more generic.

Documentation updates and a release note are included.

Closes-bug: 1584187

Change-Id: I0955e2cb8a05af4afd36aaca518322a9df6d1ff7

subject: Provide type for boolean module parameters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-31 21:14:25.000000000', 'files': ['library/neutron', 'library/glance', 'library/keystone', 'library/provider_networks'], 'message': "Provide type for boolean module parameters

Instead of inserting 'True' and 'False' into Ansible's BOOLEANS
constants, designate the parameters as a 'bool' type.
ansible.module_utils.basic will downcase and handle ensuring the
variables are cast to booleans.

Change-Id: I2fc70a90df5cca76b49fc21adee59350173157d9
"}]
commit_message:
Provide type for boolean module parameters

Instead of inserting 'True' and 'False' into Ansible's BOOLEANS
constants, designate the parameters as a 'bool' type.
ansible.module_utils.basic will downcase and handle ensuring the
variables are cast to booleans.

Change-Id: I2fc70a90df5cca76b49fc21adee59350173157d9

commit_message:
Corrected xml generation for external snapshots

This patch corrects external snapshot XML generation to get XML
according to the libvirt documentation.
It lets use external snapshot functionality with environments
that have dots in their names. Without this change system tests
fail during snapshot creation.

Tests are modified to reflect changes made in libvirt xml builder
code base as well.

Change-Id: I8c12430047eeed439e644638b458bcec3b684900
Closes-Bug: #1583139

subject: Fix live migration with shared storage
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-27 14:38:37.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/livemigrationops.py', 'hyperv/nova/pathutils.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_pathutils.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_livemigrationops.py'], 'message': "Fix live migration with shared storage

At the moment, when live migration is requested, we attempt to
copy the instance dvd disks and log files to the remote location,
other instance files being transparently copied by Hyper-V.

The issue is that we don't check whether shared storage is being
used, in which case this will fail.

This change adds this check.

Closes-Bug: #1565895

Change-Id: Ib646c90c830a1cd0e5401d14c6d400226b034f73
"}]
commit_message:
Fix live migration with shared storage

At the moment, when live migration is requested, we attempt to
copy the instance dvd disks and log files to the remote location,
other instance files being transparently copied by Hyper-V.

The issue is that we don't check whether shared storage is being
used, in which case this will fail.

This change adds this check.

Closes-Bug: #1565895

Change-Id: Ib646c90c830a1cd0e5401d14c6d400226b034f73

commit_message:
Correct nova admin endpoint version

In Liberty the primary nova endpoints changed to v2.1, but the group_var
for the nova admin endpoint was not changed appropriately.

This patch corrects the endpoint version.

subject: verify: start and import_results always print uuid
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-31 10:14:31.000000000', 'files': ['rally/cli/commands/verify.py', 'tests/unit/cli/commands/test_verify.py'], 'message': 'verify: start and import_results always print uuid

Previously UUID of verifications that ware created by these commands
with --no-use were not printed to stdout. It unnecessarily force
users to stop using --no-use or to search the UUID in rally.log or
in "rally verify list".

With this change, a line "Verification UUID: <UUID>" will always
appear in output of these command, regardless of weather if --no-use
is specified. It allows users to extract UUID by a relatively simple
filter such as "| grep -Po '(?<=^Verification UUID: ).*$'".

Closes-bug: 1587034
Change-Id: I4afbaf82472068ccf9b9c074d1d94a36fcbf246a
'}]
commit_message:
verify: start and import_results always print uuid

Previously UUID of verifications that ware created by these commands
with --no-use were not printed to stdout. It unnecessarily force
users to stop using --no-use or to search the UUID in rally.log or
in "rally verify list".

With this change, a line "Verification UUID: <UUID>" will always
appear in output of these command, regardless of weather if --no-use
is specified. It allows users to extract UUID by a relatively simple
filter such as "| grep -Po '(?<=^Verification UUID: ).*$'".

Closes-bug: 1587034
Change-Id: I4afbaf82472068ccf9b9c074d1d94a36fcbf246a

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-04-08 19:54:59.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/hardware.py', 'releasenotes/notes/enable-cleaning-fallback-57e8c9aa2f24e63d.yaml', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_hardware.py'], 'message': 'Provide fallback from ATA erase to shredding

Presently should the ATA erasure operation fails, IPA halts the
cleaning process and the node goes to CLEANFAIL state as a result.

This failure could be the result of a previous cleaning failure
that left drive security enabled, for which code has been added
in an attempt to address this case by attempting to unlock the
the drive.

In the event that an operator wishes to automatically fallback to
disk scrubbing operations, the capability has been added through
a driver_internal_info field "agent_continue_if_ata_erase_failed"
that can be set to True, however defaults to False keeping the
same behavior that IPA presently exhibits in the event of ATA
erase operations failing.

Partial-Bug: #1536695
Change-Id: I88edd9477f4f05aa55b2fe8efa4bbff1c5573bb1
'}]
commit_message:
Provide fallback from ATA erase to shredding

Presently should the ATA erasure operation fails, IPA halts the
cleaning process and the node goes to CLEANFAIL state as a result.

This failure could be the result of a previous cleaning failure
that left drive security enabled, for which code has been added
in an attempt to address this case by attempting to unlock the
the drive.

In the event that an operator wishes to automatically fallback to
disk scrubbing operations, the capability has been added through
a driver_internal_info field "agent_continue_if_ata_erase_failed"
that can be set to True, however defaults to False keeping the
same behavior that IPA presently exhibits in the event of ATA
erase operations failing.

Partial-Bug: #1536695
Change-Id: I88edd9477f4f05aa55b2fe8efa4bbff1c5573bb1

revisions:
[{'number': 43, 'created': '2016-05-31 14:09:02.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_direct_workflow_rerun.py', 'mistral/workflow/base.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/base.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_reverse_workflow_rerun.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_environment.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_workflow_resume.py', 'mistral/workflow/with_items.py', 'mistral/engine/policies.py', 'mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_join.py', 'mistral/utils/__init__.py', 'mistral/services/executions.py', 'mistral/services/scheduler.py', 'mistral_tempest_tests/tests/api/v2/test_mistral_basic_v2.py', 'mistral/engine/actions.py', 'mistral/engine/dispatcher.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_execution_fields_size_limitation.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_dataflow.py', 'mistral/engine/default_engine.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_run_action.py', 'mistral/engine/task_handler.py', 'mistral/workflow/commands.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_error_handling.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/workflow/test_direct_workflow.py', 'mistral/workflow/direct_workflow.py', 'mistral/engine/action_handler.py', 'mistral/engine/utils.py', 'mistral/engine/tasks.py', 'mistral/workflow/data_flow.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_direct_workflow.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/workflow/test_with_items.py', 'mistral/engine/rpc.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_subworkflows.py', 'mistral/engine/workflow_handler.py'], 'message': "Refactor Mistral Engine

* Introduced class hierarchies Task and Action used by Mistral engine.
  Note: Action here is a different than executor Action and represents
  rather actions of different types: regular python action, ad-hoc
  action and workflow action (since for task action and workflow are
  polymorphic)
* Refactored task_handler.py and action_handler.py with Task and Action
  hierarchies
* Rebuilt a chain call so that the entire action processing would look
  like a chain of calls Action -> Task -> Workflow where each level
  knows only about the next level and can influence it (e.g. if adhoc
  action has failed due to YAQL error in 'output' transformer action
  itself fails its task)
* Refactored policies according to new object model
* Fixed some of the tests to match the idea of having two types of
  exceptions, MistralException and MistralError, where the latter
  is considered either a harsh environmental problem or a logical
  issue in the system itself so that it must not be handled anywhere
  in the code

TODO(in subsequent patches):
 * Refactor WithItemsTask w/o using with_items.py
 * Remove DB transaction in Scheduler when making a delayed call,
   helper policy methods like 'continue_workflow'
 * Refactor policies test so that workflow definitions live right
   in test methods
 * Refactor workflow_handler with Workflow abstraction
 * Get rid of RunExistingTask workflow command, it should be just
   one command with various properties
 * Refactor resume and rerun with Task abstraction (same way as
   other methods, e.g. on_action_complete())
 * Add error handling to all required places such as
   task_handler.continue_task()
 * More tests for error handling

P.S. This patch is very big but it was nearly impossible to split
it into multiple smaller patches just because how entangled everything
was in Mistral Engine.

Partially implements: blueprint mistral-engine-error-handling
Implements: blueprint mistral-action-result-processing-pipeline
Implements: blueprint mistral-refactor-task-handler
Closes-Bug: #1568909

Change-Id: I0668e695c60dde31efc690563fc891387d44d6ba
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor Mistral Engine

* Introduced class hierarchies Task and Action used by Mistral engine.
  Note: Action here is a different than executor Action and represents
  rather actions of different types: regular python action, ad-hoc
  action and workflow action (since for task action and workflow are
  polymorphic)
* Refactored task_handler.py and action_handler.py with Task and Action
  hierarchies
* Rebuilt a chain call so that the entire action processing would look
  like a chain of calls Action -> Task -> Workflow where each level
  knows only about the next level and can influence it (e.g. if adhoc
  action has failed due to YAQL error in 'output' transformer action
  itself fails its task)
* Refactored policies according to new object model
* Fixed some of the tests to match the idea of having two types of
  exceptions, MistralException and MistralError, where the latter
  is considered either a harsh environmental problem or a logical
  issue in the system itself so that it must not be handled anywhere
  in the code

TODO(in subsequent patches):
 * Refactor WithItemsTask w/o using with_items.py
 * Remove DB transaction in Scheduler when making a delayed call,
   helper policy methods like 'continue_workflow'
 * Refactor policies test so that workflow definitions live right
   in test methods
 * Refactor workflow_handler with Workflow abstraction
 * Get rid of RunExistingTask workflow command, it should be just
   one command with various properties
 * Refactor resume and rerun with Task abstraction (same way as
   other methods, e.g. on_action_complete())
 * Add error handling to all required places such as
   task_handler.continue_task()
 * More tests for error handling

P.S. This patch is very big but it was nearly impossible to split
it into multiple smaller patches just because how entangled everything
was in Mistral Engine.

Partially implements: blueprint mistral-engine-error-handling
Implements: blueprint mistral-action-result-processing-pipeline
Implements: blueprint mistral-refactor-task-handler
Closes-Bug: #1568909

Change-Id: I0668e695c60dde31efc690563fc891387d44d6ba

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-18 13:31:39.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/forms/views.py'], 'message': "Add *args, **kwargs to ModalBackdropMixin's init method

Before this change ModalBackdropMixin called super(...).__init__()
without arguments. This imposed restrictions on what classes this
mixin could have been mixed into, i.e. only classes, that do not accept
any parameters.
This proved to be a problem for murano-dashboard, since it uses this
mixin (indirectly through ModalFormMixin) and mixes it into a class,
that accepts parameters to it's init method.
This change allows to use ModalBackdropMixin with classes that have
init methods with parameters.

Change-Id: I6155476738021b784ef7e643c968f1d784b15906
Closes-Bug: #1582816
"}]
commit_message:
Add *args, **kwargs to ModalBackdropMixin's init method

Before this change ModalBackdropMixin called super(...).__init__()
without arguments. This imposed restrictions on what classes this
mixin could have been mixed into, i.e. only classes, that do not accept
any parameters.
This proved to be a problem for murano-dashboard, since it uses this
mixin (indirectly through ModalFormMixin) and mixes it into a class,
that accepts parameters to it's init method.
This change allows to use ModalBackdropMixin with classes that have
init methods with parameters.

Change-Id: I6155476738021b784ef7e643c968f1d784b15906
Closes-Bug: #1582816

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed
even if environment variables of the proxy are set. This is a
new feature above tox 2.0, you can check it from [1].

This patch fix this problem.

[1]. https://tox.readthedocs.org/en/latest/example/basic.html#passing-down-environment-variables

Change-Id: I8b963e85e5ba15e0d10e7ab1ec722433a9615b3a

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-26 05:06:31.000000000', 'files': ['tests/hacking/checks.py', 'rally/common/db/__init__.py', 'tests/unit/deployment/test_multihost.py', 'tests/unit/test_api.py', 'tests/unit/test_hacking.py', 'rally/deployment/engines/multihost.py', 'tests/unit/cli/test_manage.py', 'tests/functional/test_task_samples.py', 'tests/unit/cli/test_cliutils.py', 'tests/unit/common/objects/test_deploy.py', 'tests/unit/test.py', 'rally/cli/manage.py', 'tests/unit/common/objects/test_task.py', 'rally/verification/tempest/config.py', 'tests/unit/common/db/test_api.py', 'rally/common/objects/verification.py', 'rally/common/objects/deploy.py', 'tests/unit/verification/test_config.py', 'rally/common/objects/task.py', 'tests/hacking/README.rst', 'tests/unit/common/objects/test_verification.py'], 'message': 'Avoid using wildcard (*) imports

In general, import statements should be as specific as possible
and only import needed module. When from module import * is used,
you are implicitly loading all locals of the imported module into
and over the importing module. This has two disadvantages: first,
you might unintentionally overload already imported objects. Second,
it becomes difficult to detect undefined names in the program that
imported the module.

Change-Id: I65f8b3f40f5a89232144d3c399a4aa3bd13ee62c
Closes-Bug: #1535787
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid using wildcard (*) imports

In general, import statements should be as specific as possible
and only import needed module. When from module import * is used,
you are implicitly loading all locals of the imported module into
and over the importing module. This has two disadvantages: first,
you might unintentionally overload already imported objects. Second,
it becomes difficult to detect undefined names in the program that
imported the module.

Change-Id: I65f8b3f40f5a89232144d3c399a4aa3bd13ee62c
Closes-Bug: #1535787

subject: [ops-guide] Clarify maintenance mode for computes
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-31 14:16:28.000000000', 'files': ['doc/ops-guide/source/ops_maintenance_compute.rst'], 'message': '[ops-guide] Clarify maintenance mode for computes

The doc section does not currently highlight the fact that VMs can
still be scheduled to the compute node which is about to be shut off
for maintenance, unless nova-compute service is explicitly disabled
in Nova. Without this migration of workloads may never complete.

Closes-Bug: #1587450

Change-Id: I36697bb1556d96c31171fcc55d988a5b8bcfa1cd
'}]
commit_message:
[ops-guide] Clarify maintenance mode for computes

The doc section does not currently highlight the fact that VMs can
still be scheduled to the compute node which is about to be shut off
for maintenance, unless nova-compute service is explicitly disabled
in Nova. Without this migration of workloads may never complete.

Closes-Bug: #1587450

commit_message:
Use CONF.network.tenant_network_cidr instead of hardcode cidr

There is a config option in neutron to allow user give the cidr
block to allocate tenant ipv4 subnets from. Nova test should use
it when create network too.

Change-Id: I735a224d75a9b185016ed0d0c881611d02082a6c

commit_message:
Use CONF.network.floating_network_name to create floating IP

Currently, tempest give no pool infomation when creating floating IP,
it relys on nova-api service to find default_floating_pool from nova.conf.
When default_floating_pool in nova.conf is missing, The test will fail.

Change-Id: I8daae3f2c980cee1b10652bcdaf7eaf52cc33f0a

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-05-31 10:55:24.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/live-migrate-rescued-instances.rst'], 'message': "Live Migration of Rescued Instances

When an instance is rescued the libvirt driver creates a file in the.
instance directory that contains the original instance xml. This file
is used when unrescuing the instance to revert to the original disk
configuration. However, this file is not necessary to restore the
instance's original configuration. Furthermore the reliance on this
file means we currently cannot live migrate a rescued instance.  Thus
it is proposed that we do not create this file during the rescue
operation and rebuild the instance's original xml file from the
database when we unrescue it.

APIImpact
Change-Id: Id3a055f00c3f8ef006911e2523c8d284f449b524
"}]
commit_message:
Live Migration of Rescued Instances

When an instance is rescued the libvirt driver creates a file in the.
instance directory that contains the original instance xml. This file
is used when unrescuing the instance to revert to the original disk
configuration. However, this file is not necessary to restore the
instance's original configuration. Furthermore the reliance on this
file means we currently cannot live migrate a rescued instance.  Thus
it is proposed that we do not create this file during the rescue
operation and rebuild the instance's original xml file from the
database when we unrescue it.

APIImpact
Change-Id: Id3a055f00c3f8ef006911e2523c8d284f449b524

commit_message:
Copy/remove the strongswan.d config as root

The strongswan.d config dir (usually /etc/strongswan.d) is usually owned
by root but the neutron-vpn-agent may run as non-root so the files need
to be copied as root to not get a "permission denied" error.

Change-Id: I40785f8c89b304efdf0f95469ec5a2d57b0cad60
Closes-Bug: #1586986

The neutron integrated jobs (gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full and
gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron) are still configured to run with fwaas
(and lbaas) extension, however the decoupling is  ongoing (as
shown in [1]).

Running these jobs on fwaas changes is not only wasteful but it

removed.

[1] Ic60cd1fa90c19dfac00be583e2ddc5633dbb68a3

Change-Id: Id7c6af8d52a779ca0861970333d4c45d89aee566
'}]
commit_message:
Remove integrated jobs from neutron-fwaas project config

The neutron integrated jobs (gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full and
gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron) are still configured to run with fwaas
(and lbaas) extension, however the decoupling is  ongoing (as
shown in [1]).

Running these jobs on fwaas changes is not only wasteful but it
will eventually not provide any test coverage, so they can be
removed.

[1] Ic60cd1fa90c19dfac00be583e2ddc5633dbb68a3

Change-Id: Id7c6af8d52a779ca0861970333d4c45d89aee566

subject: Refactor hostname resolution via DNS
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-31 15:33:24.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_rabbit_utils.py', 'hooks/rabbitmq_server_relations.py', 'hooks/rabbit_utils.py'], 'message': 'Refactor hostname resolution via DNS

Due to oddities in the way that DNS used to work on older MAAS
versions, specifically when using LXC containers, the charm
would endeavour to discover a full forward/reverse resolvable
hostname/ip address to use when clustering with peers, and to
set the internal nodename for each RMQ instance.

Changes in MAAS 2.0 mean that an IP address may resolve to more
than 1 DNS record, making identification via DNS of the FQDN
problematic.

The charm actively manages /etc/hosts with IP address/hostname for
all peer units in a RMQ cluster using the cluster relation; make
use of this feature to allow the internal nodename of each unit
to actually be the hostname of the server, as the charm is ensuring
the resolvability of hostnames within the cluster.

To avoid races where the lead unit has not had its hostname written
to /etc/hosts, only cluster with the lead unit in the hook execution
where this actually happens.

Change-Id: Ia400c3b6e2cb1a5f2ee6f5fe98b5437033e02024
Closes-Bug: 1584902
(cherry picked from commit 7ffdcd204e6550cf5dcad57ed07ea302c1eedcce)
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor hostname resolution via DNS

Due to oddities in the way that DNS used to work on older MAAS
versions, specifically when using LXC containers, the charm
would endeavour to discover a full forward/reverse resolvable
hostname/ip address to use when clustering with peers, and to
set the internal nodename for each RMQ instance.

Changes in MAAS 2.0 mean that an IP address may resolve to more
than 1 DNS record, making identification via DNS of the FQDN
problematic.

The charm actively manages /etc/hosts with IP address/hostname for
all peer units in a RMQ cluster using the cluster relation; make
use of this feature to allow the internal nodename of each unit
to actually be the hostname of the server, as the charm is ensuring
the resolvability of hostnames within the cluster.

To avoid races where the lead unit has not had its hostname written
to /etc/hosts, only cluster with the lead unit in the hook execution
where this actually happens.

Change-Id: Ia400c3b6e2cb1a5f2ee6f5fe98b5437033e02024
Closes-Bug: 1584902
(cherry picked from commit 7ffdcd204e6550cf5dcad57ed07ea302c1eedcce)

subject: Notifications fixes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-27 09:48:49.000000000', 'files': ['src/__tests__/reducers/notificationsReducer.tests.js', 'src/js/components/notifications/Notification.js', 'src/js/components/notifications/NotificationsToaster.js', 'src/js/constants/NotificationConstants.js', 'src/js/reducers/notificationsReducer.js', 'src/js/selectors/notifications.js', 'src/js/immutableRecords/notifications.js', 'src/__tests__/actions/NotificationsActions.tests.js', 'src/js/actions/NotificationActions.js'], 'message': "Notifications fixes

Make the notifications stack properly

Rename 'persisted' property to
'timeoutable' to better match it's purpose, make 'timeoutable' part of
the notification Record, so the action which triggers the notification
can decide if notification uses timer or not in similar manner as
it is done with 'dismissable'

Make timeoutable notifications Timers pause on hover on Notification
Toaster instead of Notification itself to enable user to review the
notifications

Mark hidden Notifications as viewed instead of deleting them

Closes-Bug: 1586333

Change-Id: If050c563b8a78dc4a606ebe6bd8e77ce906a708f
"}]
commit_message:
Notifications fixes

Make the notifications stack properly

Rename 'persisted' property to
'timeoutable' to better match it's purpose, make 'timeoutable' part of
the notification Record, so the action which triggers the notification
can decide if notification uses timer or not in similar manner as
it is done with 'dismissable'

Make timeoutable notifications Timers pause on hover on Notification
Toaster instead of Notification itself to enable user to review the
notifications

Mark hidden Notifications as viewed instead of deleting them

Closes-Bug: 1586333

Change-Id: If050c563b8a78dc4a606ebe6bd8e77ce906a708f

subject: Django compressor cannot find custom theme templates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-31 12:45:28.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/themes.py'], 'message': "Django compressor cannot find custom theme templates

An else condition was missed in the Theme Template loader.  Some
templates that are loaded from a theme do start with '/', so
another elif was added to catching this possibility.

Closes-bug: #1582298

Change-Id: I74e147d5abdcb2ab12f1a0c8e7af7fc7f89aff1e
(cherry picked from commit 4b870b12c139bda715c9d68e53daf80b51034d42)
"}]
commit_message:
Django compressor cannot find custom theme templates

An else condition was missed in the Theme Template loader.  Some
templates that are loaded from a theme do start with '/', so
another elif was added to catching this possibility.

Closes-bug: #1582298

Change-Id: I74e147d5abdcb2ab12f1a0c8e7af7fc7f89aff1e
(cherry picked from commit 4b870b12c139bda715c9d68e53daf80b51034d42)

Add content from DHCP in HA mode

This commit adds the DHCP in HA mode configuration.
It has been copied from the Admin Guide. Next step is
to remove the content in the Admin Guide and inlcude
the respective reference.
